intro: Lavandula pinnata var. formosa, commonly known as the showy lavender, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States. It features slender, aromatic stems and lance-shaped leaves with a gray-green hue. The plant produces spikes of fragrant, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for xeriscaping. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its compact size and long-lasting blooms.
